cards.text: ##domino##a tool for collaging thoughts
domino is attempting to be a tool i can use to collage thought fragments in a presentable way
##motivation##read on to find out what domino is trying to do and why it was created
##technical details##read on for information about how domino is made
##how to use##read on for details of how to make your own boards
##roadmap## read on to find out planned features for domino
i'm using pug to generate the html so i can edit the scripts/style/etc separately rather than in one long html file
usually i make my tools in typescript via create-react-app (without react)--doing it raw (and now via pug) has been surprisingly easy
everything is a single standalone html file that makes a copy of itself when you export a project
for ease of distribution, i think it's essential that tools export to a single standalone html file (when possible)
this page is both an exported domino project and the domino editor
you can customise the styling of the board by editing the css of your export
i like the idea that just by distributing an export you're also distributing the tool for someone to create their own
that exported board is now an editor that makes boards in your customised style
i need to clean up the html/css/javascript now things are solidifying--want it to be robust straight forward to modify
"domino" because putting thoughts with something in common adjacent to each other reminded me of matching dominoes
##blog post##read more about the inspiration and goals of domino on my blog

double click on a card to jump to it

click and drag to move around freely
domino is a board of hand-placed cards
it's supposed to be kinda like a mind map, but with all links implied by proximity
click the home icon üè† to return to the center of the board
##navigating##moving around and reading a domino board
##editing##creating or remixing a domino board
if the toolbar at the bottom of the screen shows üîí, the board is locked to prevent accidental editing. click it to üîì to allow editing
click on a card and then the writing icon üìù to edit that card
if you have and feedback, especially bug reports, please do contact me
i have no access to macOS or iOS so reports, particularly about bugs on safari, are appreciated
##contact##you can contact me on twitter, mastodon, or email
##source code##the source code and build scripts for domino are available on github
##blog post##a self-replicating and mutating tool?
this has some side-effects on how users get access to updates
but any changes you have made will need to be reapplied again manually--*'merged'* in software parlance
domino is released as a single domino board (this one). to update a local copy, you simply replace it with a copy of this board
users?--or participants in a software ecosystem?
every exported board is a backup of the specific editor version used to create it
consequently it may not be worth the effort to update
if the editor was functional enough to create the exported board, then it's probably sufficient for future edits too
you can, of course, import the board into a more up to date copy of domino if that isn't the case
the proliferation of updates to domino is beyond my individual control
perhaps someone else develops a more popular variant
perhaps a more popular variant emerges organically from generations of small changes made by individuals
there are parallels with open source software, and parallels with memes and remix culture
##navigating##moving through larger boards

`keyboard shortcuts

spacebar:   toggle zoom out
arrows:     move to adjacent card
e:          edit card
s:          speak card
esc:        exit window
##mobile support##mobile technically works, but the user experience isn't great
closing the editor doesn't seem to work in firefox mobile, but i don't have any way to debug this--help?
would like to add free zooming by mouse wheel and pinching now that zoom is supported
##moving cards##i probably need to add some more powerful tools for moving cards around
you can only move one card at once, and you can only move it to somewhere you can see
what if you could drop cards into am intermediate holding area then drag them back out where you want them?
##emoji##card icons are intended to be emoji, but...
some emoji seem to get rendered as text instead of emoji...
alternatively (or additionally?) i'd like to add an editor similar to broider for making custom icons
##extra structure##thinking about extra structure beyond layout cards on a grid

`experimenting with an
iframe/image feature

in icons:
display:http://bla.com
image:http://bla.com/a.png
browser extensions for privacy break many image hotlinks, and many pages prevent iframe embedding--as a fallback i open a new tab
sometimes you really do want to write a linear block of text--what if cards could contain a larger post that can be expanded?
i've largely cleaned up the css, so i welcome any feedback on how i could make it clearer for modding
##images##experimentally, i now support dragging in local files as images
i'm concerned about file size, so i heavily compress the images--kinda like low tech magazine
maybe i can offer some different compression aesthetics e.g dithering
click and drag to move cards around the board (moving to free spaces or swapping with an existing card)
click and drag the cards icon (üóÉ) onto an empty cell to create a new card
drag a card onto cards icon (üóÉ) to remove it
there is some support for styling e.g **bold** and *italics*. you can also ~~strikethrough~~ text and make ##headings##

`there is some support for 
styling e.g **bold** and 
*italics*. you can also 
~~strikethrough~~ text and 
make ##headings##
click "üìÇ import from html" to load domino board for editing
you can click "‚ùå remove all cards" to completely clear the board--be careful, there is no undo!

`‚†Ä‚†Ä ‚†Ä  ü§†      howdy. im
„ÄÄ  ü§†ü§†ü§†   the sheriff
   ü§† ü§† ü§†   of cowboy
  üëá  ü§†ü§† üëá  hat face
     ü§†„ÄÄü§†
„ÄÄ  ü§†„ÄÄ ü§†

you can add new card
styles by editing
the css style

why not try making a 
border in broider?
the selectors beginning with `.domino-card-` are just examples, you can add any number of your own as long as the class starts with `domino-card-`
check out this custom styling by Martin O'Leary--you can import his board to try it out for yourself!
you can change a card's appearance in the **style** section of the card editor
you can hyperlink to another card by using the coordinates like #3,-7 (check the url bar)
i'd like to provide some guidance on editing the styles soon, but for now you'll need to find out about CSS on your own
you can upload images as card backgrounds (they will be compressed severely)
card icons are a way to add hyperlinks (and later, more) to cards. each card has room for four emoji links
##menu##click ‚ùî on the toolbar to open the global menu
click "üì¶ export to html" to save the board to html
a domino board exported to html can be uploaded as a viewable webpage, imported into domino to edit, or used to edit itself
**why not share it on**
you can also drag images from your computer, and paste in copied images
it's also possible to drag images from another browser tab, but various security features may prevent this
when unlocked, navigation behaviour changes: double clicking cards opens the editor, and cards become draggable
different platforms support different emoji and users can't be certain that the icon they choose will be visible to someone else
are there emoji polyfills? are the javascript emoji libraries out there too heavy for this tool?
it'd be nice to have an emoji picker...
a couple people recommend twemoji to me. looks promising
##saving##exporting a copy every time you want to save is kinda annoying

is it possible to embed twemoji rather than externally linking it?

i'd like it to work offline
i want a board to be standalone, so the images ought to be embedded in the single html document
**it's jpeg images**
